intro: Xantolis sericea, commonly known as the silky xantolis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its finely hairy, silver-green foliage, which gives it a distinctive, almost silvery appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Xantolis sericea is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
